newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK interbank rates, bill yields little changed.
newsitem.headline: HK interbank rates, bill yields little changed.

text.p: Hong Kong interbank rates were little changed and government paper yields edged up slightly on Tuesday as players chose to stay sidelined in keeping with a quiet overnight United States market, dealers said.
Overnight cash stood at five percent at Tuesday midday from Monday's 4-7/8 percent while three months stood at 5-1/2 7/16 percent versus 5-9/16 7/16 percent previously.
"The market is very quiet, people are waiting for what the Federal Reserve will do," a dealer with a local bank said.
The lack of activity weighed down prices on bills and notes slightly, pushing up yields, dealers said.

The one-week bill yielded 4.87 percent against 4.84 percent on Monday while the seven-year Exchange Fund note yielded 7.57 percent against 7.56 percent, five-year 7.24 percent versus 7.16 percent and three-year 6.59 versus 6.57 percent.
Dealers said the market was likely to stay in a tight range until the the U.S. Federal Open Market Committee meets on September 24 to decide whether or not to change monetary policy.
